meanings.definition: To spend more money than someone or something
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outspend her friends when they go shopping.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to outspend its competitors in advertising.
meanings.sent3: The billionaire decided to outspend the entire town on fireworks for the Fourth of July.
meanings.sent4: In the world of luxury cars, it's easy to outspend your budget without even realizing it.
meanings.sent5: The extravagant wedding ceremony seemed to outspend all previous events in the small town.

meanings.sent1: The government tends to outspend its budget every fiscal year.
meanings.sent2: If you continue to outspend your income, you will soon face financial troubles.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner managed to outspend his energy reserves before reaching the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious project aimed to outspend all previous records in terms of resources utilized.
meanings.sent5: The artist's vision for the exhibit required them to outspend their initial estimates to bring it to life.
